Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2009 10:57AM Jodi_Smart wrote: Hi Amiekae,  I am 29 and have 3 kids, 8,4 and 4 months.  I was diagnosed on 2/26/09 and just had a double mastectomy on 3/19/09.  I opted for that due to my young age and family history.  I was home alone with my 3 month old and my 4 year when I found out on the phone from my dr. and I broke down crying and my 4 year asked me why was I crying??  I told her mommy was sick and didn't feel good.  When I decided to have the double mastectomy we decided to finally tell the kids what was going on.  I told them that mommy had a buggy in her boobie and so the dr. has to take my boobies away...lol!  My 4 year laughed and my eight year old said, "well it's better to do that then to be sick and die"!  It really shocked me at how much he interpreted what I was trying to tell him.  But we laugh now about mommies fake boobies!!!  I am going to be meeting with my oncologist tomorrow to discuss my chemo treatment plan.  My surgery removed all traces of the cancer and no nodes were invovled, but again due to my age I will still have to follow up with chemo treatment than tamoxifen.  I am confident that I am going to be ok and going to get through this.  I could not have done this without my husband by my side and family and friends and most importanly my children!!!  They are the light in my every day and I suggest to anyone going through something like this to live through your kids when you feel down!!!  They love you no matter what and they always seem to make all my worries and fears go away when I am feeling like there's no tomorrow!!!!  Good luck and please keep us posted as to how you are doing!  My prayers are with you and your family!!  Hugggssss!!!!!
Posts.Title: 31 and just diagnosed amiekae Jodi_Smart

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2009 10:30AM Jodi_Smart wrote: Hi Ruth, I was diagnosed on 2/26/09 with infiltrating ductal carcinoma.  I choose to have a bilateral mastectomy even though the bc was on the right side.  BC runs in my family and I'm only 29 years old with 3 kids, 8,4 and 4 months and didn't want to have to worry about the left side 5 years down the line.  I had the surgery on 3/19/09 and the tumor was 2.2cm and they also found DCIS as well in the right side.  My nodes were negative and my surgeon was able to remove any surrounding tissue that was infected.  I'm waiting now to hear from the oncologist because I will most likely have to do some chemo because of my young age, but my dr. is very confident that I will beat this!  I have chosen not to have reconstruction right now.  Later on down the line I may change my mind, but my first priority is to get rid of and beat this thing!!!  So, for me having the bilat mastectomy was the best decision I have made so far in my long journey ahead!  Please keep us updated on how your doing!  Hugs to you, Jodi
